content:
Segment 3: A Meeting of Kings

King Leonidas and his 300 Spartans had landed on the shores of Africa after being lost at sea during a storm. They were greeted by the local tribe, who brought them to the nearby kingdom of Zululand, where they met King Shaka.

King Leonidas: Greetings, King Shaka. I am King Leonidas of Sparta, and these are my 300 warriors. We were lost at sea and are grateful for your hospitality.

King Shaka: Welcome to Zululand, King Leonidas. I am honored to meet you and your warriors. Please, come and share in our hospitality.

King Leonidas: Thank you, King Shaka. Your kingdom is beautiful, and your people are kind.

King Shaka: It is good to hear that. We are proud of our land and our people. And it is not often that we receive visitors from such a far-off land.

King Leonidas: We have heard much of your kingdom and your people. We would be honored to learn more about you and your way of life.

King Shaka: And I would be honored to share it with you. Please, come and stay with us for as long as you like. We have much to learn from each other.

King Leonidas and his 300 Spartans spent the next several weeks in Zululand, learning about the culture and way of life of the Zulu people. They shared their own experiences and stories, and formed a bond with King Shaka and his people. They had come to Africa as strangers, but they were leaving as friends.
